I Was a Grovelling Creature Once

I was a grovelling creature once,
Crawling on the ground, I'd find my strength
In every fibre, every bend and every ounce
Of dirt and grime that clung to me, I'd blend
And mix with earth, becoming one with the land
My arms outstretched, my fingers grasping tight
I'd claw and dig, and slowly I'd take flight
But now I stand upright, a creature tall
My eyes cast upwards, towards the sky's great hall
Yet memories of crawling still linger on
A reminder of where I've been, and where I've gone
The earth remains, a part of me, a part of my soul
A connection to the ground, my heart's goal
